name: Kentucky Equal Justice Center (KEJC)
description: Kentucky Equal Justice Center is a non-profit poverty law advocacy center dedicated to ensuring equal justice for all Kentuckians. Founded in 1976, KEJC serves as an advocate for low-income and other vulnerable members of society. The organization works with civil legal services programs across Kentucky on cooperative initiatives including training, brief banks, and advocacy in Frankfort. They serve as a watchdog and advocate for a wide range of low-income Kentuckians from children to elders in long-term care, maintaining connections with a network of poverty law offices. KEJC has a strong track record including successful litigation challenging nursing home cutoffs, legislative successes on human trafficking and mortgage lending, innovative wage collection litigation, and growing partnerships with public interest allies. They also operate the Maxwell Street Legal Clinic.
source: Verified from official website and multiple online sources
notes: Main office: PO Box 12253, Lexington, KY 40582. Maxwell Street Legal Clinic: 315 Lexington Ave., Lexington, KY 40508. Both locations use the same phone number. 2014 Winner of Consumer Reports Excellence in Consumer Advocacy Award. Social media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram.
